entry.title: "The Foundations of U.S. Russia Policy" by Thomas Graham

media:group.media:title: "The Foundations of U.S. Russia Policy" by Thomas Graham
media:group.media:description:
Thomas Graham, special assistant to the U.S. president on Russia from 2004 to 2007, gave a talk on ‚ÄòThe Foundations of U.S. Russia Policy‚Äô at a symposium organized by the Monterey Initiative in Russian Studies at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. The lecture took place on July 9 in Tbilisi.
Thomas Graham is currently a distinguished fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations.
This year‚Äôs Monterey Summer Symposium on Russia took place in Yerevan, Tbilisi, and Istanbul from July 1 to July 20.

entry.title: Turning Points in U.S. - Russia Relations

media:group.media:title: Turning Points in U.S. - Russia Relations
media:group.media:description:
Thomas Graham, Anatol Lieven and Svetlana Savranskaya join a panel on ‚ÄòTurning Points in US-Russia Relations‚Äô at a symposium organized by the Monterey Initiative in Russian Studies at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. The panel took place on July 10 in Tbilisi.
Thomas Graham was special assistant to the U.S. president on Russia from 2004 to 2007. He is currently a distinguished fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations.
Anatol Lieven is an author, journalist, and policy analyst. He is a visiting professor at King's College London and a senior fellow at the Quincy Institute for Responsible Statecraft.
Svetlana Savranskaya is the director of Russia programs at the National Security Archives in the United States.
This year‚Äôs Monterey Summer Symposium on Russia took place in Yerevan, Tbilisi, and Istanbul from July 1 to July 20.

entry.title: Armenia to host UN Biodiversity Conference in 2026

media:group.media:title: Armenia to host UN Biodiversity Conference in 2026
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia will host a United Nations Biodiversity Conference in 2026, defeating Azerbaijan's competing bid. üìç Armenia's government postponed the implementation of its universal healthcare insurance system. üìç EU parliament smacks the Aliyev regime: youtu.be/RMTYCouSf8A?si=vPUjsq25Q39AvIDR üìç AI education to be introduced to schools across Armenia: youtu.be/B3bWyaivZAY?si=we71l4PfG5vgK4r0

media:group.media:title: Inside Tbilisi‚Äôs strange election
media:group.media:description:
In this in-depth conversation, sociologist Alexander Thatcher joins Patrick Elliott to unpack Georgia's shocking election results and their implications for democracy in the South Caucasus. The discussion explores the complex dynamics of Russian influence in Georgian politics and society, examining how Moscow's strategic interests shape regional developments.
